## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:

1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.github.simonhauck</groupId>
  <artifactId>unofficial-nordigen-api-java</artifactId>
  <version>1.7.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
  repositories {
    mavenCentral()     // Needed if the 'unofficial-nordigen-api-java' jar has been published to maven central.
    mavenLocal()       // Needed if the 'unofficial-nordigen-api-java' jar has been published to the local maven repo.
  }

  dependencies {
     implementation "com.github.simonhauck:unofficial-nordigen-api-java:1.7.0"
  }
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

- `target/unofficial-nordigen-api-java-1.7.0.jar`
- `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

import com.github.simonhauck.unofficial.nordigen.*;
import com.github.simonhauck.unofficial.nordigen.auth.*;
import org.openapitools.client.model.*;
import com.github.simonhauck.unofficial.nordigen.api.AccountsApi;

public class AccountsApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApiClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient();
        defaultClient.setBasePath("http://localhost");
        
        // Configure API key authorization: cookieAuth
        ApiKeyAuth cookieAuth = (ApiKeyAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("cookieAuth");
        cookieAuth.setApiKey("YOUR API KEY");
        // Uncomment the following line to set a prefix for the API key, e.g. "Token" (defaults to null)
        //cookieAuth.setApiKeyPrefix("Token");

        // Configure API key authorization: tokenAuth
        ApiKeyAuth tokenAuth = (ApiKeyAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("tokenAuth");
        tokenAuth.setApiKey("YOUR API KEY");
        // Uncomment the following line to set a prefix for the API key, e.g. "Token" (defaults to null)
        //tokenAuth.setApiKeyPrefix("Token");

        AccountsApi apiInstance = new AccountsApi(defaultClient);
        UUID id = UUID.randomUUID(); // UUID | 
        try {
            apiInstance.retrieveAccountBalances(id);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AccountsApi#retrieveAccountBalances");
            System.err.println("Status code: " + e.getCode());
            System.err.println("Reason: " + e.getResponseBody());
            System.err.println("Response headers: " + e.getResponseHeaders());
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

```

## Documentation for Authorization

Authentication schemes defined for the API:
### basicAuth


- **Type**: HTTP basic authentication

### cookieAuth


- **Type**: API key
- **API key parameter name**: Session
- **Location**: 

### tokenAuth


- **Type**: API key
- **API key parameter name**: Authorization
- **Location**: HTTP header


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
